section.title: Interface introduction
section.para: Client side security is set up by either setting individual properties on the javax.xml.rpc.Stub object used for the web service method invocation or by setting properties on a client side security descriptor object, which in turn is propagated to client side security handlers by making it available as a stub object property. Here are examples for the two approaches:
The descriptor file is described in detail in .

row.entry: Allows for configuration of credentials for authentication.

entry.para: Value equals the Instance of org.ietf.jgss.GSSCredential.

row.entry: Allows for configuring client side authorization.

entry.para: If GSI Secure Transport or GSI Secure Conversation is used the value should be an instance of org.globus.gsi.gssapi.auth.Authorization. But this translation is done automatically by the toolkit.

entry.para: Value equals the instance of javax.security.auth.Subject.
The credential object needs to be wrapped in org.globus.wsrf.impl.security.authentication.encryption and added to the set of public credentials of the Subject object.
